website_summaries.verdict: The Columbia Newton Ridge Plus II Waterproof was able to impress day hikers with its comfortable feel and minimal break-in period. Its grippy outsole and lightweight design were also generally well-received.However, while its affordability enamored a gear pundit, the boot’s low-quality sole build and ineffective waterproofing were issues that turned off the other purchasers. That being said, the Columbia Men’s Newton Ridge Plus II Waterproof still delivers in terms of performance. Its blunders, however, might scare away potential buyers.
pros: A majority of Columbia Newton Ridge Plus II Waterproof users said that the boot was very comfortable to wear
This day hiking footgear took a short amount of time to break in, as testified by a large percentage of owners
Numerous outdoor enthusiasts raved about the lightness of this footwear
Based on several consumer reviews, this gear gripped well on challenging surfaces, especially on wet rocks
An expert found the hiker incredibly affordable
cons: A significant number of buyers were disappointed that the sole came off after using it for a few times
Some hikers said that the footgear’s waterproofing wasn’t effective
Its ankle support was considered insufficient by a professional blogger

customer_reviews.title: 7 month follow up. Huge fan
customer_reviews.text: I love these boots. They lasted me 7 months before the soles wore smooth about average for me. No tearing or delamination of the sole. Just bought my 2nd pair and did a 13 mile hike strait out of the box. Every other boot I've had in the past has destroyed my feet attempting such a feat. I'll be buying another pair in 7 months....
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Definitely waterproof
customer_reviews.text: My husband ordered these for a trip to Oregon. Figured he needed something waterproof yet good to walk around and hike in. We also went to Mt Hood to play in the snow (about 6"). He was the only one in our group to keep dry feet so they definitely work! He also said they were pretty comfortable and he has a few foot issues. He ordered his normal size and they fit fine. Also worked well on the wet, slippery paths along the coast and all.
customer_reviews.author: Younique by Crissy

customer_reviews.title: Light weight extremely waterproof
customer_reviews.text: There is nothing I can say bad about these boots, they were cheap. I work outdoors and bought these as a lighter option from the standard work boot. I walk many miles each day through different terrain for at least 12hrs a day with no trouble. This boat is as light as a sneaker and durable, I have had these boots almost completely submerged in water multiple times in the cold with with no leaks which is a huge relief for a boat of this size and cost. I will be a future customer
customer_reviews.author: CphpTop Contributor: Fishing

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly comfortable and durable!
customer_reviews.text: Good shoe for the price! I don't hike width them. I wear them to work. They look like work boots but are much lighter and way more comfortable. I go through a pair of good work boots in a year. I hoping for a good six months from these since they are lightweight and half the cost. Boy was I surprised. I got a year out of these baby's. Original laces and all. I'm on my second pair. Two thumbs up!!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle L. Silva

customer_reviews.title: Does not hold up at all. Shame on Columbia.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these about 4 months ago and the seam where the rubber meets the boot leather is already completely coming apart. The toe rubber is also peeling off. These are "under warranty" so I figured I could get a replacement pair to at least get me another 4 months of use, so I tried to file a claim and find out I have to pay for shipping and send them back for REPAIR. If they cant repair these then they will give you a store credit based on the condition of the boot!!!! ARE YOU KIDDING!?!?! NEVER buying Columbia boots again. SHAME!
customer_reviews.author: Scooter

customer_reviews.title: Waterproofing works good but what up with the Sole wear?
customer_reviews.text: The shoe fits great after breaking them it and the water proofing works great to. I wear these everyday to work so I except them to last about 6 months. Unfortunately the sole grip has worn out so fast, I can't safely work with these shoes anymore. I'm moving back to my original Merrell Moabs that last me 6 months. The upper shoe and material are still holding up well, but the sole wore out so fast to my surprise, I would think they should of lasted a little bit longer for a $70+ shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made with no arch support
customer_reviews.text: Shoes are cheaply made with poor orthopedic features. Flat inner sole. Absolutely no arch or ankle support. Normally one cant hike in such shoes...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good so far...
customer_reviews.text: Although it's only been about 4 days. They are comfy, waterproof, and fit very nicely. I would give them a full 5 stars but really can't in good conscience so quickly. Leaving in a few days for a vacation in the mountains. I'll revisit my rating after that.
customer_reviews.author: Monte Savage

customer_reviews.title: 3 years later different product
customer_reviews.text: I bought these boots three years ago and pout some major miles on them. I was incredibly pleased with them. My new purchase is tight and poor support/comfort all around. I measured the new product (size 12) with my old product (size 12). There is a noticeable difference in the two. Sure, someone can say the three year old pair is broken in but when I only measure the rubber bottom - the new pair is shorter and not as wide. I can't imagine rubber stretched out that much. I had a similar problem with size 12 Timberlands... I'm willing to bet that the companies are shrinking the sizes to save on production... Let's see what the response is....
customer_reviews.author: Rick B

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly tough...
customer_reviews.text: Very tough. Takes a beating. Says its water resistant but I still sprayed 3M scotch guard water repellent all over the boot so when they to get dirty, all I have to do is wipe with a damp cloth and the look fine. Very good for the price. Beats the heck out of my way over priced Timberland boots. They can be used for hiking but I use them for work and they surprised me. Going to have to get another pair very soon. Try them, I'll bet you won't be disappointed at all....
customer_reviews.author: R A

customer_reviews.title: Performs wonderfully but radically uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.text: The boots, generally, fit great. The left boot was perfect, but the right boot would press top down over the first, left eyelet. Unfortunately, this area has the underside of the metal grommet and stitching, which was incredibly uncomfortable. Width was fine, length was fine, but for some reason there was acute top-down pressure in that one spot. Had to return; won't be trying a second pair. Aside from the tremendous discomfort, they performed great: waterproof, good insulation, and good traction in sub-zero Minnesota winter.
customer_reviews.author: Dan H.

customer_reviews.title: A little better than the price point
customer_reviews.text: 1 year after purchase: These are closer to hiking boots than winter boots. They get comfortable real quick, meaning they break in fast. The leather isn't as thick, or tough as it looks, and at the tip, where my big toe touches the leather is getting worn thin to the point where it feels like my toe is about to tear through any minute now. The rubber sole gets worn out fast if you do a lot of city walking, but if you are using these for trail hiking only, then they should last you a while. I paid about $60 maybe a little more, and I think I got more than my moneys worth.
customer_reviews.author: ACMora333

customer_reviews.title: ouch
customer_reviews.text: The incest souls are about 1/8th of an inch thin. its uncomfortable to say the least. You'd have to buy new souls to try to make it work. The area around the ankles is very hard and stiff with no real support so when you walk it grinds against your ankles like a hard peace of plastic. Overall its very low quality - feels like something you'd pay $3 for at the sale bin at payless. The positive reviews for htis shoe seem fake.
customer_reviews.author: attilakb

customer_reviews.title: Buy at least one size bigger....
customer_reviews.text: So I bought a a half size bigger because I figured it would be a tight fit but it ended up being very tight fit regardless , I can't use these shoes if they're going to make my feet hurt just by trying them on for only ten minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Jairtzinio O.

customer_reviews.title: Pretty dang good
customer_reviews.text: These lasted me as work boots on my farm from may 2019 to February 2020. They were very comfortable and definitely waterproof. Now after about 10 months of heavy use, a lave hook has broken off, they aren't waterproof and the front tread is pulling away from the toe. I patched it with shoe glue but my feet are still getting damp now after working if its wet out, but all in all about 10 months of almost constant use on a farm is pretty decent I think for a pair of boots! I might buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: Duke

customer_reviews.title: Good while they last
customer_reviews.text: Had these for about 15 months. Yes waterproof. Yes warm. Fit is off compared to other same brand boots. My heals and side fo heal rubbed heavily against back and side wearing out inner cover, Side stitching ripped at seem making boots useless. Issue is single stitching in super tight rows weakening the material. soles wear out way too quick for urban or work wear. wore about 3 months total (rain and light snow) . Warranty just expired so for money's worth i cant recommend these. Shame as everything else is a plus
customer_reviews.author: Al

customer_reviews.title: Nice boot, great price. Well made so far. Use-hiking trails
customer_reviews.text: Very nicely made boot. Not too heavy, not too thin either. Bought primarily to takes the kids hiking and what not. Muddy trails, creek beds, etc. Works well for that purpose. Have only had in water about 1- 2” deep walking across stream/creeks without any leaks. Not sure if trust them anything deeper. Few splashes of mud/water and light rain didn’t bother them either. Fit - slightly wide toe box and hard to get laces in that part tight enough for me. I have a medium foot, not narrow, not wide. Normally wear size 12 and I’m 6’1” tall 200 lbs. prob coulda used 11.5 size but not worth returning. Can comment on longevity yet - only 2 weeks old.
customer_reviews.author: klw

customer_reviews.title: Something is wrong with these shoes
customer_reviews.text: They just don't fit right. I have another very similar pair from Columbia in another color and those boots are awesome! These boots however are so flat that my toes were squished against the top and the front. And I ordered up 1/2 a size. Also, the heel part is not quite right. My heel slips up. I think these are seconds. I ordered a size 8. Just felt completely off.
customer_reviews.author: MG

customer_reviews.title: First hike great, second hike even better
customer_reviews.text: As novice hiker, I worried about how these boots would work. I broke them in on Wright Peak in the Adirondacks outside Lake Placid over the Memorial Day weekend in 2019. This hike was through muddy streams, slippery rocks, and steep rock faces. The boots never slipped or let me down. I sunk my leg up to my thigh in mud yet nothing got inside the boot. The comfort during the 6 miles hike and 2,400 feet of elevation change was outstanding throughout. I really like these boots and highly recommend them to other novice hikers like myself.
customer_reviews.author: John Moliski

customer_reviews.title: Best boots I’ve ever owned
customer_reviews.text: I’ve hiked in boots, worked in boots, and I generally wear boots as shoes to walk the dogs and do my chores- so needless to say, I wear them a lot. This is my 5th pair of these boots. I have never found a better pair. I’ve owned Vasque, Morrell, Timberland and many other brands of boots and these are by far the best! I have a regular size 11 foot with a regular width and a mid rise arch....
customer_reviews.author: Crystal

customer_reviews.title: Well made, sturdy, great for yard work or hiking
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because I liked some Columbia hiking boots that I have used for over 10 years. I didn’t know whether I would use these as my new hiking boots or for yard work, but needed to break them in anyway. So I used them for yard work to start. I think I will continue to use them for this purpose, although I also wear them for short walks in the woods. I’ll keep my old Columbia boots for longer hikes for now. But these would also work well. So I recommend them for both. They are comfortable and durable. After several months, they show little signs of wear.
customer_reviews.author: Beeb

customer_reviews.title: Wading Use Bonus
customer_reviews.text: Excellent boots for strenuous hiking and moderate backpacking. Very comfortable tread feel, but I don't think they would be adequate for backpacking with a 50+ pound load on scree. Some reviewers seem to have problems with size, but I find they are very true to size and I very much need wide shoes. (My review may show 12M size, but I actually buy and wear 11W) Bonus is the Omni-Grip sole which is better than Korkers Aqua Stealth for gripping rocks while fishing in rivers. And they hold up very well wading in the river for several days.
customer_reviews.author: California Doug

customer_reviews.title: Great all around.  Rugged and reliable. Comfortable. Good looking.
customer_reviews.text: My go to shoe. Well made. Rugged and reliable. Had a very similar pair of these from Columbia previously. Wore them so much, for years, and wore them out. Glad to find they are still making these. Great traction. Great comfort. Good arch and ankle support. Fine product. Goes great with jeans and such. Stands up to all sorts of activities in all seasons and weather. I appreciate the well made speed lacing hooks at top also. The other manufacturers could take some lessons from Columbia on these. Hope they make these forever.
customer_reviews.author: john flagg

customer_reviews.title: Horrible!! Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: After 3 months use, sole came apart. Horrible!! Do not buy, super cheap
customer_reviews.author: Shen

customer_reviews.title: Good Boot,  Salt Stains
customer_reviews.text: Let me be clear- these boots are quality built and comfortable. Strong and durable Laces and eyelets/ hooks. My issue is that my feet sweat...a lot. And I wear these for work. All the sewn seams/ stitches have a white residue which I am assuming is salt from my feet sweating. And there is no real way to get rid of it, because it will just come back. But this is my problem, not the boot! Also, these are a dull/ matte black, not a high gloss finish. So you can't really polish or buff out any scratches or scrapes.
customer_reviews.author: Boston Jonny

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed. Not similar to the mudhawks
customer_reviews.text: I realized Columbia discontinued the mudhawks aka their best hiking boots. I rocked them for 4 years until they started letting water in through the seems. I bought the newton ridge plus ii because they looked like the closest to the mudhawks. I have never been so disappointed when they arrived. Compared to the mudhawks, the sole changed from a grip level of 9/10 to 5/10. The waterproof level went from 10/10 to 2/10. The ankle support went from 8/10 to 1/10. The comfort level went from 9/10 to 7/10. These boots are best used to walk around the city and not for hiking. No matter how tight I pull the shoelaces, the ankle always comes loose.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Martin

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable and light weight, like a sneaker. I had no blisters, but that also depends on sizing correctly and proper socks. I wear 9 1/2 (Mostly boots) to 10 and these 9 1/2 fit perfectly. I wore these for a few days of 2-4 miles of hiking and had no problems. Its sufficiently water resistant, but no shoe is 100% water proof, lets be honest. I got compliments on them as well.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Solid Boot 💪
customer_reviews.text: Traction on this bad boy is great. Fit is perfect. Comfortable, durable, very happy with a boot under $100. My girlfriend has a pair and told me dirt washes off of it like Teflon. She has had hers for a couple of years. I have not muddied them up yet, so I cannot verify that this boot does exactly the same thing, but I feel good knowing that Columbia put a lot of quality in this line. Bottom line - if you like the look, everything else will be great also. Update- I had to fetch a ball out of a river and immersed my feet completely in water, and they were not wet. It truly is water proof.
customer_reviews.author: Dezem

customer_reviews.title: Ladies, don't follow the size chart
customer_reviews.text: According to their sizing chart, the men's 9.5 is the same size as the women's 10.5. Didn't sound right to me but they're the manufacturer so they must know what they're talking about, right? I ordered the size 9.5 and a women's 10.5 in the same style and as I suspected, the men's is significantly larger. I had about an inch of room at the toe. And that was with liners and thick wool socks! Ladies, if you're thinking about getting a men's pair of these, don't follow their size chart. You'll probably need a full size smaller than it suggests. Other than that, it's a really nice boot but unfortunately I have to return it.
customer_reviews.author: D.J.T.

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable and look great too
customer_reviews.text: The size was perfect for these boots and they look even better once you get them on your feet. The only thing I ended up doing was buying gray laces so the laces didn't stand out so much. Waterproof and keep your feet dry in the cold winter of Chicago.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Wayne Harej

customer_reviews.title: Too large and the sole is totally uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: I won't use them for serious hiking, my feet may burn after a little use. Pros: - Well made, they seems to be durable. (+1 star) - Water resistant, I use them to do agricultural work in mud and wet grass, without complaints about humidity (+1 star) Cons: - They run too large, I think they are one full size larger (-1 star) - The sole is totally uncomfortable compared to my old Timberland, it really hurts after a while. (-1 star) - Too expensive considering these cons (-1 star)
customer_reviews.author: J. Castro

customer_reviews.title: Hot, Hard and not good for your feet!!
customer_reviews.text: First day wore the shoes for 5 hours, not bad. Second day wore them for 9 hours, developed pain in both heels. Third day wore them for 15 hours, shin splints and my socks were wet. I was wearing cool max socks and have never had any problems with moisture. If you are going to wear them all day. I would look elsewhere for something else. Going back to my Danner boots. I guess you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond T. Driscoll

customer_reviews.title: Great boots!
customer_reviews.text: I wear a 10.5 for most brand of shoes and these fit great. Did not get a chance to break them in before a 4 day backpacking trip, but I still had no issues. They are surprisingly lightweight and provide great traction and ankle support. They kept the water out, as long as the water level was below the top of the boot. we did do a lot of hiking in some pretty deep snow, which did make its way into the boot and got the inside wet. However, the wet boots were able to dry overnight after leaving them open and out.
customer_reviews.author: alex

customer_reviews.title: Good looking and comfortable right out of the box.
customer_reviews.text: I just received these boots so I cannot testify to their longevity just yet. They are a light boot which is what I wanted. The soles are soft rubber so they have good traction right out of the box but probably won’t last a real long time. I’ll update that later. I purchased these for a two week trip I’ll be taking this summer. They seem well made and look good. They are pretty light weight and are comfortable right out of the box. They shouldn’t need much break-in. The price was a factor in purchasing these boots. I think they’ll hold up well to some light hiking and walking around on my vacation. So far I would recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: ray dawson

customer_reviews.title: Blistered into my second mile
customer_reviews.text: Maybe my expectations were too high coming from Columbia, but the back of these shoes have NO cushion around the heel area... I barely finished my second mile into the hike and I couldn’t go any further without bandaging/wrapping my heels.. on BOTH sides ! The rest of the shoe is great... felt sturdy... waterproof as I walked through a 4” deep pond... looks nice... but the pain from blisters is not worth it. Even my cheap $20 boots from Big 5 have way more cushion/support in the back. The back of these shoes is super hard with a thin layer of fabric over it.
customer_reviews.author: Gina

customer_reviews.title: Permanently damaged my ankles at 23 years old
customer_reviews.text: Looked great, light, comfortable... and then once the soles were worn down 2 months’ worth, did permanent damage to my ankles. I’m not kidding, I still experience pain that started with these. After switching to another pair I had laying around, it got better, but I switched back to these and walked two blocks. Immediately the pain flared up again. No, insoles did not help.
customer_reviews.author: David the WavidTop Contributor: Batman

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes, great value.
customer_reviews.text: These are awesome, nothing to complain about. I purchased these for my best friend who likes practical clothes, and also REALLY doesn't like shopping for new clothes for himself. So this purchase was to help him finally get a new pair of boots on his feet. I was worried they might not fit right, but they went on his feet, and basically never came back off. That's a tacit 5 star review from him, trust me. He's already got a nice layer of mud on them which means hes taking them hiking- as intended. And all without spending too much money, thank god. They also look real good and handsome (when they're clean).
customer_reviews.author: Purp. Drink

customer_reviews.title: Comfort and Sophistication.
customer_reviews.text: I got a pair last year for work and two for casual wear. I like the comfort when walking and the style. They go with any casual or semi-dress outfits. I have several pair in different colors and I am not disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony W

customer_reviews.title: Awesome hiking boots!  Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.text: Love these things! I wore them for a trip and just kept wearing them to work afterwards since they were so comfortable. They fit perfect and are great on the trail with plenty of arch support and good traction in dirt, gravel, and rocky terrain. I'll buy another just like these when I wear them out. Be sure to wear them in a bit before going hiking or you'll end up with a blister. Thick socks are a good idea with these.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Barker

customer_reviews.title: Good boot
customer_reviews.text: They are a decent boot, just what I wanted. They kept my feet dry when I went for a walk in a heavy rain and I did step in a couple puddles. They did keep my feet somewhat warm but they are not insulated so I didn't expect them to keep warm during winter weather. I do recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Michael B.

customer_reviews.title: Not the quality you would expect from Columbia
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed in the lack of quality in this boot. I'm a return Columbia boot customer that is sorry to say they lost me as a customer. Purchased these in Late Dec 2018 and by March this year had to Krazy glue the side soles back on both boots. By Mid July they were junk on the right side outer, the material split about 4 inches (not repairable).The left inside boots heel material came apart causing irritation. Use to get 1 1/2 to 2 years out of Columbia boots. These didn't last 6 months. Just purchased a pair of Smith & Wesson's guess I'll see how they hold up?
customer_reviews.author: Junior

customer_reviews.title: Solid, comfortable walking boot
customer_reviews.text: I walk a mile each way to work each day, and bought these for my winter commute when the snow isn't too deep. They're warm enough and dry, comfortable for a hike on sidewalks and paved surfaces, and while I've only done one season in them, seem to be holding up really nicely, with little tread wear and no apparent structural weakening. Tight seams, solid eyelets etc. I'm very happy with these boots, and would definitely buy Columbia again. (In fact, I did... after a couple weeks with these, I bought a pair of their snow boots for more serious winter weather!)
customer_reviews.author: S. B.

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, lightweight, and waterproof.
customer_reviews.text: I've been wearing these almost daily for 3 weeks to break them in before a scheduled hike in the mountains. I find them all-day comfortable, no blisters or pinching. A gully washer came up while I was inside. The field I parked in was ankle-deep in puddles when I came out and ran 50 yards to my car. My feet stayed bone dry! These are great! I also ordered Skechers Relment-Travens and Propet Ridge Walkers from Amazon Wardrobe at the same time. These are the ones I kept and I'm convinced I made the right choice.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Winter

customer_reviews.title: Lucky to have chosen these as my first pair of hiking boots!
customer_reviews.text: These boots have been my faithful companions on many hikes. They were my first pair of hiking boots so I cannot compare to others. That said, they are durable, comfortable, supportive, and waterproof. They are not as lightweight as, say, tennis shoes, but not heavy either. The soles have gripped reliably. What more could one ask for? I found I needed a half size larger than my normal shoe size. Recommend.
customer_reviews.author: JG in NC

customer_reviews.title: Not waterproof at all
customer_reviews.text: Just walked through wet grass in these, and my sock and top of my foot is soaking wet. The water soaked through the front part of the tongue where it begins, and the sock above is dry, water did not go over the top or down the ankle, it simply soaked right through the not waterproof tongue under the laces. If you stand in a puddle that is several inches deep, sure waterproof...but walk through wet grass, or God forbis submege the laces for a full second, and your socks and foot will get soaking wet. 2 starrs for the $55 I paid.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Anderegg

customer_reviews.title: Good all purpose boots for bad weather
customer_reviews.text: Been wearing them occasionally for the past year. Wore them to a Buffalo Bills game this past December. It was cold and raining the entire time and my feet stayed dry. I did use toe warmers to help with the cold... in my opinion these boots aren’t really going to protect you from the cold all that well. I have worn them hiking as well. They are sturdy and comfortable. I don’t wear them every day so it’s hard to comment on their long term durability, but I own a couple of Columbia outerwear items that have held up quite well over many years.
customer_reviews.author: David Kimmer

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable at first, but don't last
customer_reviews.text: These boots were very comfortable right out of the box. I could hike or stand in these all day and feel great. The downside is that, after 7 months of wearing them a couple of times a week, they are starting to break down. The sole is separating from the leather all along the front of both boots. I am very disappointed since I was quite pleased when I first bought them. As they are, I suppose I can use them around the house as a work-shoe, but I don't trust these for any long trek or travel anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Paola Turner

customer_reviews.title: Super deal!  Great Boot!
customer_reviews.text: For $70, you CANNOT get a better quality boot. Waterproof - check Durable - Check Looks good - Check Lifetime Warranty - Check!!! I had another pair of Columbia boots, lasted 4 years and sole started to come off, Columbia gave a gift card for the entire value of the boot...so I bought these! AWESOME DEAL! Great Product and company that backs their products...like Eddie Bauer...both have LIFETIME WARRANTY on all items!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Russ H

customer_reviews.title: On a whim! Good light-weight, general hiking shoe!
customer_reviews.text: Fit=fantastic! The good: Fits and feels like Keen!! Like wearing a casual slipper around the cabin! The Bad: .........Nothing really. For the price point it is decent. Qualitative review i'd say it will last like a great pair of walking shoes, for me 3-6 months before they're toast. I think Columbia did some serious research and R&d. Good fit, average style(who cares), and very comfortable. Hiking durability time will tell.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny Johnstone

customer_reviews.title: Good boots
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these specifically for hiking. I have WORK BOOTS for work. I have taken these on several short hikes, and one overnight backpacking trip. They are comfortable, and do the job. Are they fully waterproof? I don't know yet, but they have a gusseted tongue, etc., and I have no doubt they would keep my feet dry or at least "not too moist" if I somehow managed to fully submerge them in water somewhere (generally, I try to avoid this).
customer_reviews.author: J.H. Knight

customer_reviews.title: It is not shell cordovan
customer_reviews.text: Decent hiking boot. Not the best quality construction but not terrible either. The sole is glued on. So it could come apart in about 6 months to 1 year unfortunately. The leather is not the nice high quality shell cordovan that many quality boots are made with. It looks durable however and is advertised as waterproof. I received mine for about $50 (open box item) and for that price it is worth it.
customer_reviews.author: myoclonus

customer_reviews.title: Expected high quality, guess what...
customer_reviews.text: I bought these boots almost a year ago. I have worn them to work almost everyday, 5 days a week from 8-5 with light indoor work and the occasion hike in the woods. The leather has not held up well, cracked and flaked. The "waterproof" aspect worked for a little while but after the leather cracking and the sole pealing from the shoe, they are worthless. I would not buy these again. I was hoping to find a good everyday work/hiking boot I could repeatedly purchase over the years. These ain't it.
customer_reviews.author: mph114

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I hoped for at first, soggy mess shortly afterwards.
customer_reviews.text: I work outdoors and need a true waterproof boot. These held up through a month of daily rain and my feet stayed dry. Not only that, but they are comfortable to boot. I would buy these again. Edit: after one month of rain, these leak like they're made out of cheesecloth. I kept hoping I somehow tied them incorrectly or maybe water rain down my legs, but it's not the case. Water goes right into these boots. They are comfortable and have great tread, they are just not waterproof at all. I wish I had the same experience as everyone else on here.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don’t get these unless you like blisters
customer_reviews.text: WOW, I wish I’d of read more about these boots. Columbia does a good job with their outter wear but they dropped the ball on this one. After 1 hour I started developing blisters on my heels. I’ve tried several times to break them in but because they are soooo stiff they are not breaking in and they are not comfortable. Will be returning these.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Diefenthaler

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Comfort right from the first outing. Update: After 9 months of wear the foot bed is gone....No support left in the insert. Called customer service and there response is: box it up....at a cost to me.. and send it back and they will repair or replace them. No return label etc. I wear these to work each day.....so I just purchased a different brand as a replacement. My first of Columbia hiking boots didn't last. They are comfortable but wont last a year wearing them 5 days a week. Maybe if you just use them for hiking once in a while?
customer_reviews.author: Greg P.

customer_reviews.title: More comfortable than my gym shoes
customer_reviews.text: I bought these boots to do some hiking at Peninsula State Park. I wore them for a day to feel them out and they were more comfortable than my Puma shoes. I put about 10 miles on them during the hike and they were very comfortable. I did not get them wet so I can't comment on how 'waterproof' they are, but for the price I think they deserve 5 stars!
customer_reviews.author: TF

customer_reviews.title: Very Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Easy to fit based on size charter. This is an excellent hiking style boot. Very Comfortable all weather boot. Stands up to WI weather, Ice, snow and rain
customer_reviews.author: Verlyn Steinbach

customer_reviews.title: Good boots
customer_reviews.text: I'm updating me previous review to say that the sidewall is tearing out after three seasons. I wouldn't be so annoyed at this if it weren't for the fact that the way the boot is constructed means there's no extra material (leather) to bond back to the sole. There's EXACTLY enough to reach the sole, but no overlap-- so shoe goo or whatever can't repair these. The other downfall is maybe because of the waterproof nature of the boot, but they tend to get uncomfortably warm and damp. I usually want to kick them off if I'm not outdoors, so wearing them to work isn't a good plan.
customer_reviews.author: julio

customer_reviews.title: My feet stayed nice and dry.
customer_reviews.text: I had to work outside yesterday for several hours in pouring down rain. At one point, I was standing in a puddle with the water going over the tops of the shoe. When I got home and took them off my feet were still dry. These met and exceeded my expectations!
customer_reviews.author: Todd S.

customer_reviews.title: 1st pair GREAT second pair CRAP
customer_reviews.text: I work for UPS so trying to find a pair of reasonably priced boots that last is tuff! This is my second pair of these. The first pair lasted about a year before they completely blew out. The other brands I bought before these I was lucky to get 4-6 months. So I was impressed. I just bought my 2nd pair of these and its only been about 4months and they are already starting to tear on the sides and the traction is about gone, very dissipointed in the second pair. I give the first pair a 5 but this second pair is more of a 2 which is the reason for my 3 star review.
customer_reviews.author: zack

customer_reviews.title: Conquer the Mountains with these Boots!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these just prior to my trip to Banff for a lot of hiking on trails, snow, ice, mud and these boots were absolutely incredible! These are certainly waterproof as I hiked through some deep snow, mud, puddles, and never once did my feet get wet. They also handled extremely well hiking/scrambling through loose rock. They are also very light and comfortable. For what you get at this price, it's a no brainier. Don't think about it, just get them, you won't regret it!
customer_reviews.author: DP

customer_reviews.title: Would have at least liked an exchange
customer_reviews.text: Several holes wore into the soles within just a few weeks, letting in torrents of water. Would have at least liked an exchange, but JUST missed the window for returns/exchanges.
customer_reviews.author: Angel

customer_reviews.title: Good deal for the price
customer_reviews.text: Packaging was fine. Prime deliver was on time. After putting about twenty miles on the shoes. the fit is comfortable despite being tight across the top of my toes on both boots. The toe tightness isn't new for me, so I am used to putting molesking across the tops of my toes. All in all, these boots are comfortable. In addition, after hiking through standing water several inches deep and knee high wet grass several times, they proved to be waterproof. I gave them four stars instead of five due to the lacing set up. instead of holes and heavy hardware, the hardware does not inspire confidence for more than a weekend hike.
customer_reviews.author: Appalachian Son

customer_reviews.title: Good quality with minimal arch support
customer_reviews.text: Fits as described. Good looking waterproof boots. I use them for sailing because of their non-marking soles and I don't like traditional sailing shoes. I would not use them for any back-country, extensive hikes, or backpacking, as there is minimal arch support. Someone with high arches, like myself, will not even touch the insole at the arch, but that's nothing that a good pair of insoles can't fix.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel L.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing boots
customer_reviews.text: Used for 100+ miles of backpacking, 15+ camping ventures, and endless amounts of hikes. These do it all, rain, sleet, snow. For the price they are extremely comfortable, and the waterproof held up in snow shin deep, though I use wool socks I never got wet. Will be buying another pair considering after 2 years I put a hole in the side and there’s not much trek on the bottom. Highly recommend as a hiker/backpacker..
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable and a great price!
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable and a great price! I bought these boots, as an alternative to the Timberland hikers, and I am very happy with them. They are very comfortable and lightweight, but not flimsy, either. They have great arch support, which is very helpful when hiking. Overall, a solid hiking boot at a very competitive price!
customer_reviews.author: Greg Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: Da Bomb
customer_reviews.text: As someone who makes his living with boots on, these are the bomb. Lightweight and very comfortable. I'm going to have to order another pair for day-to-day wear. This pair is getting trail dirty tomorrow.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Just a bit too narrow.
customer_reviews.text: The boot sure seemed nice and well made- it reminded me a lot of Hi-tec Altitude boots that I've worn for years. For all of my other boots and shoes I wear a 13, regular width. I read that this shoe may run a bit small, but they didn't have a 13.5 for me to order so I thought I'd try a size 13. As it turns out, the size 13 was fine length wise, but it felt too narrow. I would have returned it for a wide version, but they did not sell one, so I just returned it for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: StephanieB

customer_reviews.title: Columbia boot
customer_reviews.text: Good boot runs at least a half size small. I am brutal on hiking boots as I actually use them outdoors in rough environments as hiking boots should be...expectation is what you expect for a overhyped brand that relies more on cosmetics than durability. With that said the average outdoor person or someone looking for style over functionality this is a good choice with good price point for average wear in a recognizable brand.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Montana

customer_reviews.title: Uncomfortable, not water proof.
customer_reviews.text: I usually buy timberland, but i decided to try these out. Very good support. The problem i have with them. Metal clips that hold the laces dig into top of my feet. I've been trying to break them in for three days now. No luck. Wouldn't buy this brand again for footwear. Not waterproof either after a few months. It's winter and my feet get soaked.
customer_reviews.author: EA

customer_reviews.title: 4 and a half stars
customer_reviews.text: There is not a lot of padding in the sole of these boots but still they are comfortable. I’ve had them for a few weeks and have had them very dirty to th point that I thought they would be my new work boots. With some water and a scrub brush they came up brand new! 99% water proof even after being submerged an inch from the top. The only down side so far is the tread pattern holds onto any mud till in the House then it lets go!
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: I love these boots so much
customer_reviews.text: I love these boots so much! They fit perfectly for me and keep my feet dry all day. I work at a car wash and have never had my feet get wet while wearing these (So long as I wear jeans and not shorts, then the water drips down my legs into my socks, but that's at no fault of the boots). I would highly recommend these to anyone who works in a wet environment. If mine ever wear out I'll be sure to purchase the same pair again.
customer_reviews.author: David K

customer_reviews.title: Great Boots
customer_reviews.text: I love these boots. They fit as expected and are very comfortable. I have problems with my feet, they hurt all the time, sometimes worse than others. I put some inserts in these boots and wore them all day at an Outdoor show shortly after they arrived. We did a lot of walking, more than I could normally ever do. I am glad that I bought these and I highly recommend them. I do a lot of reviews and I can be very critical, but I really don't have anything negative to say about these boots.
customer_reviews.author: Linam g

customer_reviews.title: The hiking boots would make a good medieval torture device.
customer_reviews.text: On first look boots appear ok but once worn, you realize the materials of boot are cheap. The lacing system uses eyelets attached with rivets to body of boot. Since the boot is unlined except in the cheapest possible way, the rivets can be felt. I initially thought the pain from the rivets would disappear as the boot warmed up and gave it a couple of days. I was painfully wrong. Each step drove the rivets into the top of my arch and was almost cripplingly painful. I returned the boots as soon as I could to avoid being crippled. Haven't worn the boots of a couple of days but the pain persists. Cheap is what you get.
customer_reviews.author: Blitzen

customer_reviews.title: Fit? Great. Are they comfortable? Yes. Waterproof? Definitely!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because I do door-to-door sales and these shoes are very comfortable to walk in and I no longer have to worry about wet feet during the rainy season. I have not worn these when the weather gets hot so I don't know if they will be comfortable then. Otherwise, they have kept my feet, warm, comfortable and dry, which is all I can ask for in a shoe that isn't ridiculously expensive.
customer_reviews.author: G. Downey

customer_reviews.title: Did not last
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these boots 4 months ago and now they are falling apart. There was a leak in one of the shoes but was minor so powered through but after 4 months of light use the soles are separating from the shoes. I can not recommend purchasing these boots. And personally I will be avoiding this brand for future shoe purchases, I have never had a pair of shoes last less than a year, and that includes $20 "cheap" off brand shoes.
customer_reviews.author: T.

customer_reviews.title: True All Day Comfort & Waterproof
customer_reviews.text: I loveeee these boots. Great companion to my Columbia outerwear. Here in PA, we are already seeing the wet season and wearing these boots I have yet to experience any water getting inside my boots. Not to mention, the all day comfortability wasn’t a lie! I’m currently a maintenance tech and I’m usually on my feet all day but I have yet to feel that burden while wearing these boots. I originally strictly purchased these boots for fishing and camping but now I cannot take them off, wonderful!
customer_reviews.author: Darius Scott

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 17 months in a farm environment
customer_reviews.text: I liked these boots - after a short break-in period, they were comfortable. One of the boots lost its waterproofing after about six months, and the sole completely failed on the same boot after 17 months. I worked on a hobby farm in Michigan, so I had them in mud and snow, along with just a lot of normal workdays doing farm chores. For the price.... eh, I'm not terribly outraged, but I'm not going to buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel A. Zatkovich

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Hiking Boots
customer_reviews.text: It is my first hiking boots for serious hikings. I purchased for my recent trip to New Zealand recently. Light weight and very comfortable as I even wore them on long overseas flights. It still seems to be in a good shape after 90 miles tough hikings with a total of elevation gain about 15000 ft. It also did well in rock scrambling during hiking at Old Rag Mountain Track in Shenandoah National Park last weekend.
customer_reviews.author: L. Huang

customer_reviews.title: Good boots, but stain my feet.
customer_reviews.text: They are great boots, comfy, nice looking. Wear them to work. BUT, all the sudden the insides of them stain my socks and feet. My toes are now a lovely blue color. It's actually quite annoying. All of my white socks are now blue. They've never been wet, so I've no idea why all the sudden the dye is coming out of them. I paid a good bit for these boots for there to be anything wrong with them, so I'm pretty unhappy about it. Edit: I bought them December 29th. So not even 2 months has gone by.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: This is actually my second pair. It's rugged and holds up to hiking conditions fairly well. Nice leather that keeps the water out. I like the traction for hiking coupled with the ability to wear everyday. When I did have to replace them it was because of the soles coming unglued. Don't know if that's a manufacturing defect or a testament to how much I'll beat them up. I'd buy again for a 3rd time.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Not durable anymore.
customer_reviews.text: I've been buying these boots for my son for some years. The last two pairs had the sole separate from the toe of the boot. The first time, I thought it was a fluke and replaced it. This boot I bought in Sept. and it failed in June. Very disappointed and now have to shop for new boots again.
customer_reviews.author: Rich Nelson

customer_reviews.title: It's a nice pair of boots
customer_reviews.text: It's a nice pair of boots. They fit well, but when it comes to durability, they don't last long if you do a decent amount of walking. I used them for about 3 months, walking 10 miles per week, but then I noticed there was a good amount of wear on the heel and the sole. I wish the rubber sole were as durable as vibram or goodyear soles. I won't be buying another pair. Good luck to anyone buying this.
customer_reviews.author: Jose Santos

customer_reviews.title: Great if you have leg/feet issues
customer_reviews.text: I have plantar fasciitis so I'm selective and usually I hike with my running shoes as previous boots were not comfy and gave me aches. I went to the Rockies so I bought these (since it snowed) and these were wonderful. Wore it all day and no pain. Didn't slip on the snowy environment and icy conditions. My feet stayed very warm. I also have loose ankles and tend to twist them easily on the way down, these kept my ankles secure but didn't make it feel like I was restricted. I did have 1 occasion when it did twist but the boots held it well and I was good to walk right away.
customer_reviews.author: Asif

customer_reviews.title: I found my NEW hiking boot!!!
customer_reviews.text: Updated version: I have worn these now for a great many events. Wearing two pair of socks, these boots are fantastic! Very comfortable!! Good support for me. I am 56 YO, 285#'s & hike on a lot of uneven terrain while watching youngsters in the desert. Old review: "I noticed that the width of the arch & ankle are perfect! The ball & toe area seems just a tad bit large. I haven't worn them like I would normally for hiking yet, with two (2) pair of socks, though. We went camping up in the forest for 3-1/2 days and I didn't even really notice I had them on...except for bringing dirt clods in the camper, heh heh!"
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Great trail walking shoes
customer_reviews.text: We were going on a trip where we would be walking for long hours under wet conditions. I bought to men’s versions and two women’s version. My family loved it. My kids are very picky when it comes to shoes and they loved them. We were able to walk for long periods and stayed dried. This was a great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: poveda

customer_reviews.title: Work? Hike? Everday? Best shoes ever!
customer_reviews.text: This is the 3rd pair I have had, I walk miles each day for work as a chief engineer of multiple properties they last getting 8+months of hard abuse out of them. I add gel insoles and it's like walking on pillows. Oh and when they say waterproof..... just Damn! 3 hours in a flooded room and socks were bone dry!
customer_reviews.author: Mr Penny

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and solid
customer_reviews.text: Well made and comfortable. Inserts will probably eventually be added for additional comfort due to they will be worn for 12 or more hours each weekday. Being water resistant, comfortable, solid, but not heavy or bulky was important. They are needed for inspecting construction jobs and working in daily unexpected heavy rainfall. I will buy these again.
customer_reviews.author: lauryn feliciano

customer_reviews.title: Light and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: When I first tried them on, it felt a little bit tight, I thought I should pick 1/2 size larger. So I kept them on for another 30 minute or then it started to loosen up. It probably has something to do with the extremely cold weather we had. I put them on again next day and I feel amazing. The customer feed back was right, it does not need to break in. Now I know why so many people choose to buy it. It is solid, light and comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: IAmazon CustomerI

customer_reviews.title: Great boots for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to wear on a hiking trip in Israel. It's worth mentioning that I did buy a $10 Dr. Shcolls insert to put in them. We walked between 8 and 12 miles a day on both pavement and hiking trails. With the inserts, these boots were very comfortable. They have decent ankle support and good traction on the trails. We didn't experience much rain, but I did wear them in the snow yesterday for several hours and my feet stayed dry. Of all the things I bought for my trip, this was by far the best purchase I made.
customer_reviews.author: Trevor Watts

customer_reviews.title: These are a great boot. My husband is a general contractor and ...
customer_reviews.text: These are a great boot. My husband is a general contractor and is always walking out of his boots. He is so hard on shoes that I typically have to buy 3 pairs a year. These shoes lasted over a year, which was unheard of for us! They are also so comfortable that he said they were the best shoes he ever had. These shoes will be my go to shoe from now on.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: My Feet are now dry in wet weather
customer_reviews.text: I've been looking for some wet weather boots because sneakers just don't cut it. My feet were always cold after walking through somewhat moist grass and now I have dry feet with these botos. I can stomp through puddles and walking up wet ramps pushing a heavy cart is a breeze, because traction. Great boots, not terribly expensive, laces stay laced.
customer_reviews.author: spencer yan

customer_reviews.title: One pair had a weird stitch
customer_reviews.text: One pair had a weird stitch in the toe but my bf really liked them so we sent them back and ordered the same size and the new boots didn't have the weird stitch in the toe. He loved them. Perfect sizing.
customer_reviews.author: Vickie Hutchins

customer_reviews.title: Great overall boot for light to moderate conditions
customer_reviews.text: Very satisfied with this pair, I wear them for a Campus security job in all conditions except for snow, since they are not goretex nor a winter boot. They are super light and comfortable and with a decent sock your going to stay warm, unless your outside for long periods at 32 degrees, then this hiker will not be sufficient. Spray the boot down good with a good waterproofer for some extra protection and don't wade in creeks or puddles (Remember waterproof is not goretex) and you will remain dry.
customer_reviews.author: Ben S

customer_reviews.title: "Check, Check, and Check Again"
customer_reviews.text: These shoes get 3 check marks for covering 3 areas: they look just as good as they look on the picture if not better, they fit my feet(got a half size over my foot size), and they feel comfortable. But yet I haven't wore them outside which will really test them.
customer_reviews.author: komarco

customer_reviews.title: He loves the fit, and how lightweight they are
customer_reviews.text: This is his second purchase of these and has already stated when to order another pair........he really loves these boots. They are a good value, waterproof, and light. So they dont weigh your foot/leg down. He is on his feet all day long, and lots of walking so his boots have to be dependable and have traction, and wear well and provide the protection needed. These do.
customer_reviews.author: Toni Wolfie H

customer_reviews.title: Updated Review Poor Durability
customer_reviews.text: Updated review. I liked these boots initially and used them for winter hiking due to their good traction. Add you can see from the sole, they weren't worn much. Unfortunately the liner inside the boot wore quickly and dug into my heel when walking. That is unfortunate since otherwise they were very nice hiking boots. Comfortable and good durability so far. Great winter traction in snow and pretty good on ice. Lightweight and waterproof are pluses
customer_reviews.author: Nordic Guy

customer_reviews.title: Good for the money
customer_reviews.text: I utilize these shoes for work at UPS they have about a two month life as far as the length of time until they are no longer waterproof, but I find that to be the case with all brands of waterproof boots. The membrane eventually tears internally and then wet feet and a long miserable day of working in wet, cold feet. I’ve gotten to the point where I carry two pairs of boots. Good for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Barry Sell

customer_reviews.title: Update...Very, very disappointed. Nubuck worn off in 60 days of only city wear, not abused.  Will not buff out.  Save your money
customer_reviews.text: Wore HI-TECH IV ALTITUDE boots for many years and now I can’t get them so tried these. They are MUCH lighter. They are a tiny but more narrow but thinner socks and a bit more break in should do the trick. Was also concerned that these had less arch support than the HiTech’s but a week later, do not feel any difference. The Columbia Newton Ridge Plus II are my new standard. UPDATE...not holding up well. Owned them for 3 months and the nubuck is wearing off making the toes look polished while the remainded looks a like like the original suede. This is normal street use, not rough conditions. VERY dissappointed because they already look worn out.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I've had these for about 3 months now, and so far no complaints. Fits as expected, they're great to do whatever you need them to do. And also - definitely waterproof. When I read the description of the boots, I wasn't too sure of their waterproofing capabilities. But a few days after getting these, I happened to be in Venice and got stuck in the city during high tide. All of my friends had water seeping in through their shoes, but with these I didn't feel a thing. Kept all the water out, I was the happiest of the bunch.
customer_reviews.author: tutusinghsohi

product_meta.title: Columbia Men's Newton Ridge Plus Ii Waterproof Hiking Shoe
product_meta.description: A durable and lightweight hiking boot designed for a variety of outdoor activities..
feature_bullets: PU coated leather, suede, mesh upper with metal hardware.
Techlite lightweight midsole for long lasting comfort, superior cushioning, and high energy return
